page.title: 01DESCRIPTION OF STROUD
page.content: STROUD is a small town built on a hillside and situated at the confluence of five valleys.Its roads climb steeply,and the surrounding hills are used to feed the sheep that brought Stroud its main industries, first wool processing and later the manufacture of textiles.The abundant supply of water in the valleys was suitable for treating the broadcloth that became famous throughout Europe particulary the "Stroud Scarlet" used for uniforms,which is still produced in a local mill.At one time there were many factories,mills and dyeworks along the course of the River Frome,but the cloth industry has declined,but not ceased over the years.Some mills have been demolished, but others have been taken over by light industry,including engineering and woodworking.
